snippet: Wealthier countries have shown improvement but growth is still anemic, the group’s economists concluded on the eve of annual central banker and finance minister meetings in Washington.
abstract: International Monetary Fund says global growth is in 'low gear,' with 2.9 percent expansion forecast for 2013, and 3.6 percent in 2014; says wealthier countries have shown improvement but growth is still anemic and warns United States on its fiscal stalemate.
lead_paragraph: Wealthier countries have shown improvement but growth is still anemic, the group’s economists concluded on the eve of annual central banker and finance minister meetings in Washington.

headline.main: I.M.F. Cuts Forecasts for Global Expansion, and Warns U.S. on Its Stalemate
headline.print_headline: I.M.F. Cuts Forecasts for Global Expansion, and Warns U.S. on Its Stalemate
